subject: Attention Dear email owner:
body:
Attention Dear email owner:
FUND APPROVAL OF $15.6 MILLION DOLLARS
This is to inform you that your UN individual compensation funds worth
$15.6 million Dollars in United Bank for Africa Benin Republic (UBA)
has been transferred to our Bank here in Texas usa (National Bank Of
Texas) by the help of united states ambassador to United Nations, Mrs
Kelly Craft, for us to complete the transfer to you successfully
without any hitch, because we are notified on your efforts to receive
the funds direct for Bank Of Africa (UBA) which yield no positive
result, right now youâ€™re to comply with us to enable you receive the
funds as planned..
There are  (3) options for you to get your funds transferred to
you.These options include
(1) Bank To Bank Transfer
(2) Opening onlineBank Account. Payment
(3) ATM VISA CARD Payment.
here are what it will cost you to received what rightfully belong to you.
(1)  Bank To Bank Transfer $200 APPLE GIFT CARD
(2)  Opening online Bank Account. Payment $150 APPLE GIFT CARD
(3)  ATM VISA CARD Payment. $100 APPLE GIFT CARD
Do not hesitate to contact us now and also choose a transfer option of
your choice, so we can tell you the needed details to enable us to
proceed on the transfer without wasting any time. Please Note. you're
required to pay Funds Release Order fee before the funds will be
successfully transferred to you as planned.
Note: because of impostors on the internet, use this transaction code
(GOD-IS-GOOD/KT322) as a subject when contacting the bank.
Yours faithfully,
Henry Pages
Texas National Bank Secretary

subject: Re: Attention Dear email owner:
body:
Hello Henry Pages,

Wow, this is such exciting news! I can't believe my luck. I'm so grateful to Mrs. Kelly Craft for her help in this matter. 

I have a few questions though, if you don't mind me asking. Could you please explain more about the options available for receiving the funds? What exactly does each option entail?

Also, could you clarify what the APPLE GIFT CARD means in relation to each option? Is it some sort of payment method or something else?

Lastly, could you provide more details about the Funds Release Order fee? How much is it and how should it be paid?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Justine
